title: Enhancing Hospitality Practice Competency: Cognitive Load Management Strategies in Virtual Multimedia Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic digital learning tools and intermediate expertise in the relevant field (social sciences)
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can explain how multimedia design complexity (IDC) in virtual environments affects attention distribution
Learners can present at least three negative impacts of external distractions (PNI) on information retention rates
Learners can design attention management strategies in complex digital learning environments by applying Cognitive Load Theory (CLT).
Learners can compare case-by-case differences in the impact of distractions based on their digital learning experience levels.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
